result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P Straitiff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no violent contact with Antonia J. E.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and make arrangements with the Washington County Sheriff's Department within 3 days to provide the sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan P Straitiff

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def waives right to attorney.
